page.title: 12The countrydweller Part 1
page.content: For our countrydweller we interviewed an artist living at Hoplass Cottage in Rhoscrowther near Pembroke.He told us he has lived in the area for about 10 years during which time he has moved house 4 times.His last move, to Rhoscrowther, was about 5 years ago and he now feels that he is settled.He moved here from Newcastle in 1975 because,being an artist who enjoys painting birds and animals, he couldn't think of a nicer country area in which to live.He owns an art gallery in Pembroke where he sells his paintings and frames other people's.He told us that a car is essential to a countrydweller as his gallery is about 6 miles away and the only public transport was abus which runs but once a week.There is a 'country car'scheme sponsored by the County council,whereby certain people make
